law.catch_line: Property On Deposit; Presumption Of Abandonment

text.section: Communicated in writing with the person concerning the deposit; or
Been credited with interest on a passbook or certificate of deposit at his request; or
Had a transfer, disposition of interest or other transaction noted of record in the books or records of the person; or
Increased or decreased the amount of deposit; or

Owned other property for which clause (1), (2), (3) or (4) is applicable; provided, however, that the holder communicates in writing with the owner with regard to such property that would otherwise be presumed abandoned under this section at the address at which communications regarding such other property regularly are received; or
Had another relationship with the holder concerning which the owner has:
communicated in writing with the holder, or

otherwise indicated an interest as evidenced by a memorandum on file prepared by an employee of the holder; provided, however, that if the holder communicates in writing with the owner with regard to the property that would otherwise be presumed abandoned under this section at the address at which communications regarding the other relationship regularly are received.
